intro: Racosperma bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's raceme wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring compound leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions. Racosperma bakeri plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for native fauna.
